text.tspan: When 'mitering' offset polygons, the maximum distance
point 'b' can be from point 'a' is set by a limit (λ) where λ
is a multiple of delta (δ). Therefore, for any given angle
we need to know if length(ab) exceeds λ * δ.
For a given limit (λ), at what angle ß do we start to
exceed this limit? (We need to express ß as sin(ß) or
cos(ß) since these values can easily be derived from
cross and dot product expressions respectively.)
Example: if the miter limit = 2½ (ie 2½ × δ) then
So when ß > 133 deg. (or Ø < 47 deg.), point 'b' will
exceed the allowed distance from point 'a' and will
